update.description:
Smaller PR from [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/144/a-5-add-magnetometer-and-imu-sensors/diff).  
Includes imu sensor with its test.

There is still a difference between the physics gravity and the world gravity. I think that makes the imu test to have a really big tolerance. I think we can fix getting from physics the gravity value or setting the gravity with the value from SDF before merge. Worse case scenario I include the into the test sdf the same value used in physics.

This follows [Ian’s altimeter approach](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/?state=MERGED) and it is strongly based on that PR. I think we should move later this sensors into ign-sensors but we decided that can be discussed after Acropolis release.
update.title: [A-5] Add imu sensor

content.raw: Merged from default and updated new components to use pull request #147 's factory 63af138

content.raw: I think I made an incorrect comment earlier. I hadn't realized this were quaternions. The `operator*` comment I made [earlier](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/146/a-5-add-imu-sensor/diff#comment-90860686) was for `math::Pose`. Sorry for the confusion :cry:
content.html: I think I made an incorrect comment earlier. I hadn't realized this were quaternions. The operator* comment I made earlier was for math::Pose. Sorry for the confusion

content.raw: Ok, LGTM. We just have to be careful about passing everything in the constructor because that doesn't scale well. For now it's ok because it's a class internal to `ign-gazebo`, but once we move this to `ign-sensors` we should revisit the API.
content.html: Ok, LGTM. We just have to be careful about passing everything in the constructor because that doesn't scale well. For now it's ok because it's a class internal to ign-gazebo, but once we move this to ign-sensors we should revisit the API.

content.raw:
I did some last changes… I moved all sensor configuration into Load, that requires to pass more than the sdf. The other option was to add setters for gravity, name and topic. I also optimized the sensor configuration.  
  
I don’t like the Load thing, but I think it is better this way at the end… I can revert that before merging.
content.html:
I did some last changes… I moved all sensor configuration into Load, that requires to pass more than the sdf. The other option was to add setters for gravity, name and topic. I also optimized the sensor configuration.

I don’t like the Load thing, but I think it is better this way at the end… I can revert that before merging.

content.raw: I'll leave that up to you :wink:
content.html: I'll leave that up to you

content.raw: Yes… I added them for consistency. Let me know if I should remove them. Makes sense to create features on demand.
content.html: Yes… I added them for consistency. Let me know if I should remove them. Makes sense to create features on demand.

content.raw: Nice catch! Approving, let's merge when CI comes back happy
content.html: Nice catch! Approving, let's merge when CI comes back happy

content.raw: Argh, `INTEGRATION_imu_system` segfaulted on Jenkins, but passed on pipelines and is passing for me locally. I'll take a look.
content.html: Argh, INTEGRATION_imu_system segfaulted on Jenkins, but passed on pipelines and is passing for me locally. I'll take a look.

content.raw:
Gravity was not being propagated to physics, so I addressed that and fixed remaining clang-tidy warnings on 0bae3aa.

Once we have more time, I think it would be good to revisit this and add a few more tests with various velocities and accelerations.

Ready to approve with happy CI.
content.html:
Gravity was not being propagated to physics, so I addressed that and fixed remaining clang-tidy warnings on 0bae3aa.

Once we have more time, I think it would be good to revisit this and add a few more tests with various velocities and accelerations.

Ready to approve with happy CI.

content.raw:
The only thing missing I think it is the example. I feel bad copying the test file in the example folder… What if we add the altimeter, the magnetometer and the imu in a single sdf with a box \(or one for each sensor\) moving? That with instructions to read the different sensor output.

I feel that could explain how to use each sensor and build a good documentation.
content.html:
The only thing missing I think it is the example. I feel bad copying the test file in the example folder… What if we add the altimeter, the magnetometer and the imu in a single sdf with a box (or one for each sensor) moving? That with instructions to read the different sensor output.

I feel that could explain how to use each sensor and build a good documentation.

content.raw: That sounds good to me! Feel free to rename the existing altimeter world!
content.html: That sounds good to me! Feel free to rename the existing altimeter world!

content.raw: If you want I can add those changes into Altimeter later. I have to do all this for the Magnetometer too.

content.raw: I just realized the altimeter has the same problem, but we should be timestamping the messages with simulation time from `_info`.
content.html: I just realized the altimeter has the same problem, but we should be timestamping the messages with simulation time from _info.

content.raw:
You could get the world entity:

`auto worldEntity = _ecm.EntityByComponents<components::World>();`

Then get the gravity:

`auto gravity = _ecm.Component<components::Gravity>(worldEntity)->Data();`

Or, since the IMU plugin is attached to the world, you could get `worldEntity` at the `Configure` callback and store it, since it shouldn't change.
content.html:
You could get the world entity:

auto worldEntity = _ecm.EntityByComponents<components::World>();

Then get the gravity:

auto gravity = _ecm.Component<components::Gravity>(worldEntity)->Data();

Or, since the IMU plugin is attached to the world, you could get worldEntity at the Configure callback and store it, since it shouldn't change.

content.raw: Yup, I’ve just pushed it. Although I don’t like checking for [Each Gravity element](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/146/a-5-add-imu-sensor/diff#Lsrc/systems/imu/Imu.ccT206). How is the correct way to get the World entity from a given child Entity?
content.html: Yup, I’ve just pushed it. Although I don’t like checking for Each Gravity element. How is the correct way to get the World entity from a given child Entity?
